newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-RAKVERE CALM OVER PROPOSED PORK TARIFFS.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-RAKVERE CALM OVER PROPOSED PORK TARIFFS.

text.p: Possible tariffs on pork meat will have a slight impact on Rakvere meat factory revenues but the company is not going to revise its profit estimate, the firm's finance director said on Tuesday.
"We certainly do not withdraw our profit estimate as we will try to get some other resources," Teet Soorm, finance director of Rakvere Lihakombinaat, told Reuters.
Soorm said however that the proposed tariffs of 30-35 percent could make pork more expensive to the company.
Rakvere will import about 30-35 percent of its pork this year compared to 25-30 percent last year.
One third of Rakvere pork comes from local producer Ekseko, where Rakvere is a major shareholder.
Rakvere has forecast its profit at 12.3 million kroons this year compared to a loss of two million kroons last year.
A government commission proposed to the government last week to establish the port tariffs.
